name: Suvorexant
summary: Suvorexant (Belsomra) is an orexin receptor antagonist used to treat insomnia characterized by difficulty with sleep onset and/or sleep maintenance.
description: Suvorexant, marketed under the brand name Belsomra, is an oral dual orexin receptor antagonist (DORA) that promotes sleep by inhibiting the wake-promoting neuropeptides orexin A and B from binding to their receptors OX1R and OX2R. It is FDA-approved for the treatment of insomnia in adults who have difficulty falling asleep or staying asleep. Unlike traditional sedative-hypnotics that enhance GABA activity, suvorexant targets the sleep-wake regulation system, which may result in a different side effect profile. It is classified as a Schedule IV controlled substance in the U.S. due to its potential for abuse and dependence.

off_label_uses: Insomnia associated with other medical or psychiatric disorders (limited evidence)
contraindications: Hypersensitivity to suvorexant or formulation components
monitoring_required: Sleep patterns and improvement in insomnia symptoms
Daytime sedation and next-day driving ability
Signs of abnormal sleep behaviors (e.g., sleep-walking, sleep-driving)

items: Insomnia characterized by difficulty with sleep onset and/or sleep maintenance

sections.text: Dual orexin receptor antagonist (DORA) that blocks the binding of wake-promoting neuropeptides orexin A and B to receptors OX1R and OX2R, thereby facilitating sleep onset and maintenance.

adult.oral: Recommended starting dose: 10 mg once nightly within 30 minutes of bedtime, with at least 7 hours remaining before planned awakening; may increase to 20 mg if needed. Use the lowest effective dose.

sections.text: Onset within 30 minutes; duration of effect may last up to 8 hours.

other: Schedule IV controlled substance with potential for abuse and dependence
Avoid use in narcolepsy due to risk of excessive daytime sleepiness
May impair next-day driving and other activities requiring full alertness, especially at higher doses or without adequate sleep
Risk of complex sleep behaviors; discontinue if these occur

items: Effectiveness in improving sleep onset and maintenance

sections.pregnancy: Limited human data; use only if benefits outweigh risks
sections.lactation: Unknown if excreted in human milk; caution advised
sections.geriatrics: More sensitive to sedative effects; use lowest effective dose

sections.text: No formal taper required, but consider gradual discontinuation to monitor for return of insomnia symptoms.

items: Unlike benzodiazepines and Z-drugs, suvorexant works via orexin system inhibition rather than GABA enhancement
May be particularly useful for patients with difficulty maintaining sleep
Patients should only take it when they can devote at least 7 hours to sleep
